tags: i am not sorry for the length
summary: What’s so funny about 2x05 is that it made me want to rewatch 2x01 again.  It’s clear to pretty much everyone that Eve takes a...
body:
What’s so funny about 2x05 is that it made me want to rewatch 2x01 again.

It’s clear to pretty much everyone that Eve takes a deliberate detour for the ominous, her voracious desires catapulting her to new heights, but it’s quite hilarious the way her sincere interest in murder and pain and assassins creeps back up on her because in season two everything begins with a body that’s been under the ground “for months”, and has been the tiniest bit “exhumed”.

That time-stamp and the word make quite an impression in my opinion. For one because Eve acts as a cryptid when she sees Alister Peel’s body, having stabbed Villanelle without anyone knowing and now trying to shelter her feelings and choices with everything that will help her cover that experience and make her appear “normal”. But it completely backfires because “exhumed” is the perfect descriptor for how Carolyn manages to dredge up those feelings Eve tries to bury, feelings that have been around for a very long time which makes clear that the show has a searing awareness of who Eve actually is and who Carolyn thinks Eve can be. Which brings me to my second point; Eve, for all the unsettling knowledge she has, actually acts as an undisclosed entity to us. Carolyn recognizes her explicit curiosity (for true crime and Villanelle) and Eve responds to that with the same hunger she cannot contain, but is she going forward or backward, ceding control or syncing with it, spurred on by this epiphany and constituting her own shadow or getting recklessly eaten? The deeper we venture into her arc the clearer the connotations become that contour the story, but there is a huge mystery narrative regarding Eve’s Self and it’s terribly exhilirating. Then, because some moments in 2x05 have just the right beat for Eve’s accumulated interest that dial her up and show us her hidden creeks - “there’s no containing anyone like this for any length of time,” - how well does that line work for her when you look back on this moment alone?

She’s being offered water, even whiskey (things to dull her senses) yet Eve wants to eat. I love that there is an explanation for her reaction, “That’s the formaldehyde. The smell of the bodies makes you crave meat,” but how wonderful of the show to go with the verbal tics again because “crave” couldn’t be more accurate in Eve’s case. As much as she wants to deny herself those feelings that make her spiral into The Deep End it’s exactly those feelings she wants to chew on to sustain herself. I mean, think about it. Eve spends the episode in the kitchen cutting mountains of vegetables, but where does the food actually go? I know Niko goes to get some. Eve on the other hand is busy in the bathtub staring at what she’s done. And even later (2x02), despite what she tells Niko as to why “they” brought her a burger, “and I nearly threw up”, the feelings connected to her hunger when seeing Alister Peel’s body is not all-the-way disgust. Moreover, it’s that familiar fascination (with death?), which really makes Eve feel like herself. All of this is so inwardly-focused that only someone like Niko can lend credence to the idea that Eve’s not completely heartless:

But. Hold on… Not yet?

NOT YET?

*MIND FLARING SOUNDS*

WHO IS EVE WHEN SHE IS HERSELF?

I’ll be a fool and put here what the wikipedia page has to say about The Egg Ghost - “It’s name comes from its resemblance to an egg. It does not have arms, legs, nor a head, not even eyes, nose, or mouth. Legend says that when a person sees an egg ghost, he or she will die. Its origin and personality are not significant. Rumor has it that some of egg ghosts’ personalities are not incorruptible as time goes by. Or that egg ghosts change to an egg, hide themselves, and come out when they want”. Now, Isn’t 2x05 the ep where Eve is being told to “take it all away” instead of adding traits? And isn’t that pretty much what we see her do? Not only sink into her own darkness but push her hands into the needle that takes something away (HELLO PEN FROM 2x01)?

And Villanelle. The fact that Eve didn’t just cut Villanelle up but cut into herself in the process, that painfully passionate moment that calibrated so much of what they have in common. It’s so curious to me that the Egg Ghost is pretty much not a fixed entity, even though Jin builds a connection between Villanelle and this mystery faceless image that acts superior to everyone else, because how does Eve play into this? Here is something alarming and exquisitly poignant happening during Eve’s conversation with The Ghost because “Do you want to do it yourself?”, “I don’t think I have the stomach for it” and then:

I’m gonna be blunt about this since Eve is skirting around this horrifying allusion to be a Monster. Eve can hide inside Villanelle until she wants to come out.

It’s the one thing I noticed about them, except that they literally don’t know what space means since they want to touch each other all the time  When they walk through the forest for example, these two women who are more similar to each other than they know, it’s that… when Eve fails to make Jin talk it doesn’t corrupt her because she can, metaphorically speaking, change her appearance since she’s got the one person around Jin fears - Villanelle - who performs what Eve cannot look at herself yet, or doesn’t know how to do yet:

And I’m here literally dying and preparing my own funeral over this shift because it all comes back around and hits Eve square in the face, “Monster”.

The transition between Eve and Villanelle, that emotional zenith, and thus The Egg Ghost because there’s such a distance in how they process the fact of that togetherness, which makes this so compelling because who is Eve? And who can she be with Villanelle together? Especially since they can shift around and underscore those transitions and strings with their own subjectivity? I’m probably going overbroad with this, but seriously. What do you want, Eve?

What’s so funny about 2x05 is that it made me want to rewatch 2x01 again.

It’s clear to pretty much everyone that Eve takes a deliberate detour for the ominous, her voracious desires catapulting her to new heights, but it’s quite hilarious the way her sincere interest in murder and pain and assassins creeps back up on her because in season two everything begins with a body that’s been under the ground “for months”, and has been the tiniest bit “exhumed”.

That time-stamp and the word make quite an impression in my opinion. For one because Eve acts as a cryptid when she sees Alister Peel’s body, having stabbed Villanelle without anyone knowing and now trying to shelter her feelings and choices with everything that will help her cover that experience and make her appear “normal”. But it completely backfires because “exhumed” is the perfect descriptor for how Carolyn manages to dredge up those feelings Eve tries to bury, feelings that have been around for a very long time which makes clear that the show has a searing awareness of who Eve actually is and who Carolyn thinks Eve can be. Which brings me to my second point; Eve, for all the unsettling knowledge she has, actually acts as an undisclosed entity to us. Carolyn recognizes her explicit curiosity (for true crime and Villanelle) and Eve responds to that with the same hunger she cannot contain, but is she going forward or backward, ceding control or syncing with it, spurred on by this epiphany and constituting her own shadow or getting recklessly eaten? The deeper we venture into her arc the clearer the connotations become that contour the story, but there is a huge mystery narrative regarding Eve’s Self and it’s terribly exhilirating. Then, because some moments in 2x05 have just the right beat for Eve’s accumulated interest that dial her up and show us her hidden creeks - “there’s no containing anyone like this for any length of time,” - how well does that line work for her when you look back on this moment alone?

She’s being offered water, even whiskey (things to dull her senses) yet Eve wants to eat. I love that there is an explanation for her reaction, “That’s the formaldehyde. The smell of the bodies makes you crave meat,” but how wonderful of the show to go with the verbal tics again because “crave” couldn’t be more accurate in Eve’s case. As much as she wants to deny herself those feelings that make her spiral into The Deep End it’s exactly those feelings she wants to chew on to sustain herself. I mean, think about it. Eve spends the episode in the kitchen cutting mountains of vegetables, but where does the food actually go? I know Niko goes to get some. Eve on the other hand is busy in the bathtub staring at what she’s done. And even later (2x02), despite what she tells Niko as to why “they” brought her a burger, “and I nearly threw up”, the feelings connected to her hunger when seeing Alister Peel’s body is not all-the-way disgust. Moreover, it’s that familiar fascination (with death?), which really makes Eve feel like herself. All of this is so inwardly-focused that only someone like Niko can lend credence to the idea that Eve’s not completely heartless:

But. Hold on… Not yet?

NOT YET?

*MIND FLARING SOUNDS*

WHO IS EVE WHEN SHE IS HERSELF?

I’ll be a fool and put here what the wikipedia page has to say about The Egg Ghost - “It’s name comes from its resemblance to an egg. It does not have arms, legs, nor a head, not even eyes, nose, or mouth. Legend says that when a person sees an egg ghost, he or she will die. Its origin and personality are not significant. Rumor has it that some of egg ghosts’ personalities are not incorruptible as time goes by. Or that egg ghosts change to an egg, hide themselves, and come out when they want”. Now, Isn’t 2x05 the ep where Eve is being told to “take it all away” instead of adding traits? And isn’t that pretty much what we see her do? Not only sink into her own darkness but push her hands into the needle that takes something away (HELLO PEN FROM 2x01)?

And Villanelle. The fact that Eve didn’t just cut Villanelle up but cut into herself in the process, that painfully passionate moment that calibrated so much of what they have in common. It’s so curious to me that the Egg Ghost is pretty much not a fixed entity, even though Jin builds a connection between Villanelle and this mystery faceless image that acts superior to everyone else, because how does Eve play into this? Here is something alarming and exquisitly poignant happening during Eve’s conversation with The Ghost because “Do you want to do it yourself?”, “I don’t think I have the stomach for it” and then:

I’m gonna be blunt about this since Eve is skirting around this horrifying allusion to be a Monster. Eve can hide inside Villanelle until she wants to come out.

It’s the one thing I noticed about them, except that they literally don’t know what space means since they want to touch each other all the time  When they walk through the forest for example, these two women who are more similar to each other than they know, it’s that… when Eve fails to make Jin talk it doesn’t corrupt her because she can, metaphorically speaking, change her appearance since she’s got the one person around Jin fears - Villanelle - who performs what Eve cannot look at herself yet, or doesn’t know how to do yet:

And I’m here literally dying and preparing my own funeral over this shift because it all comes back around and hits Eve square in the face, “Monster”.

The transition between Eve and Villanelle, that emotional zenith, and thus The Egg Ghost because there’s such a distance in how they process the fact of that togetherness, which makes this so compelling because who is Eve? And who can she be with Villanelle together? Especially since they can shift around and underscore those transitions and strings with their own subjectivity? I’m probably going overbroad with this, but seriously. What do you want, Eve?

summary: Funny thing is, we don't get more close interaction of these characters, because as I understand it, Villanelle also offended by...
body: Funny thing is, we don’t get more close interaction of these characters, because as I understand it, Villanelle also offended by the behaviour of Eve. And even though we’ve been told all this time that they’re so close and attached to each other, it’s all bullshit. They’ll work together, but I don’t believe they’ll give us anything more. Perhaps the only downfall of Eve and the rise of Villanelle. God bless me for being wrong.

reblog.comment: Funny thing is, we don’t get more close interaction of these characters, because as I understand it, Villanelle also offended by the behaviour of Eve. And even though we’ve been told all this time that they’re so close and attached to each other, it’s all bullshit. They’ll work together, but I don’t believe they’ll give us anything more. Perhaps the only downfall of Eve and the rise of Villanelle. God bless me for being wrong.

Perhaps the only downfall of Eve and the rise of Villanelle. God bless me for being wrong.

Perhaps the only downfall of Eve and the rise of Villanelle. God bless me for being wrong.

summary:
Okay, I watched 5 episodes of season 2 Killing Eve. And I don't fucking understand what the fuck happened to Eve. 
She left...
body:
Okay, I watched 5 episodes of season 2 Killing Eve. And I don’t fucking understand what the fuck happened to Eve.

  • She left Kenny, who was her friend, because he didn’t agree with her.
  • She ignores her husband, but fuck with him when she receives a gift from Villanelle. ???????wat???????

But okay, let’s say, she likes Villanelle.

  • She helped her, risking getting caught, risking her fucking freedoms for her, and Eve couldn’t even say thank you. She yelled at her. Damn it.

She started using everyone she could. Villanelle drugs to not think about her. Come on, she loves her, she really does.

In my opinion, but Eve is much more fit the definition of “psychopath” than Villanelle.

summary: Killing Eve resumen de episodio 2x03 The Hungry Caterpillar
title: Killing Eve resumen de episodio 2x03 The Hungry Caterpillar
body:
Killing Eve resumen de episodio 2×03 The Hungry Caterpillar

¡Bienvenidas a Killing Eve! Esa serie en la que el amor y el asesinato se mezclan peligrosamente y todas estamos enamoradas de una asesina múltiple. A mí no me pregunten como hemos llegado hasta aquí, yo solo sé que este amor no se toca.

Empezamos el episodio con Eve cabreada porque acaba de descubrir que Konstantine está vivito y coleando. Los dos se enzarsan en una plática complicada como…

summary: We’ve seen Villanelle frustrated before, even angry, but never vulnerable like that. It suggests a very different side to her...
text: We’ve seen Villanelle frustrated before, even angry, but never vulnerable like that. It suggests a very different side to her than she’s ever shown before. If she and Eve started on very different poles of heartlessness, this is the first sign they might meet in the center.
source:
https://tv.avclub.com/eve-is-getting-scarily-good-at-her-job-on-a-restless-ki-1834362661 

Lisa Weidenfeld of The A.V. Club on “Desperate Times”
